snippet: Should President Obama approve the 1,700-mile Keystone XL pipeline, some foes of the project say he ought to  address climate policy at the same time.
abstract: Many environmentalists say decision by Pres Obama on whether to approve Keystone XL pipeline has huge symbolic and political importance; decision, expected in summer or fall, offers Obama rare opportunity to set parameters of energy debate for rest of his term and cement his legacy as first president to seriously address climate change; foes of pipeline expect tradeoff on climate change if it is approved.
lead_paragraph: Should President Obama approve the 1,700-mile Keystone XL pipeline, some foes of the project say he ought to  address climate policy at the same time.

headline.seo: Keystone XL Pipeline Tradeoff Is Suggested
headline.main: Foes Suggest a Tradeoff if Pipeline Is Approved
headline.print_headline: Foes Suggest A Tradeoff If Pipeline Is Approved
